## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(cars)
```

```
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00

 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00  
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


::: {.cell}

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}

library(ggcats)
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
```

```
Attaching package: 'dplyr'
```

:::

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1)

# Create 24 months of data
months <- seq.Date(from = as.Date("2023-01-01"),
                   to   = as.Date("2024-12-01"),
                   by = "month")

# Make up interest levels (0–10)
df <- data.frame(
  month = rep(months, each = 4),
  toy = rep(c("Shark stuffy",
              "Laser pointer",
              "Empty box",
              "Expensive electric toy"), times = length(months)),
  cat = rep(c("grumpy",      # Shark stuffy
              "bongo",       # Laser pointer
              "toast",       # Empty box
              "nyancat"),    # Expensive electric toy
             times = length(months))
)

# Add invented interest patterns
df <- df %>%
  mutate(interest =
           case_when(
             toy == "Shark stuffy" ~ pmin(10, 6 + sin(as.numeric(month)/50)*3 + rnorm(1,0,1)),
             toy == "Laser pointer" ~ runif(n(), 7, 10),
             toy == "Empty box" ~ pmin(10, 5 + cos(as.numeric(month)/40)*3 + runif(1,0,2)),
             
             # Expensive toy: brief early interest, then drops to nothing
             toy == "Expensive electric toy" ~
               ifelse(month < as.Date("2023-04-01"),
                      runif(n(), 7, 10),
                      runif(n(), 0, 2))
           )
  )
```
:::





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(df, aes(month, interest)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = toy), linewidth = 2, alpha = 0.6) +
  geom_cat(aes(cat = cat), size = 2) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, 10), breaks = 0:10) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c(
    "Shark stuffy" = "#3581B8",
    "Laser pointer" = "#E63946",
    "Empty box" = "#6A994E",
    "Expensive electric toy" = "#9D4EDD"
  )) +
  labs(
    title = "Coda's Interest Over Time",
    y = "Interest Level (0–10)",
    x = "Month",
    color = "Toy"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank())
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](PlotTrialCAT_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=960}
:::
:::
